aicpa-topic.title: SEC Rule 17a-5, “Reports to Be Made by Certain Brokers and Dealers”

body.p: 3.103 Broadly, SEC Rule 17a-5 describes the reports to be made by certain brokers and dealers, including audited and unaudited financial statements, FOCUS Reports, and customer statements. Additionally, it discusses reports of auditors and other procedures around obtaining an independent auditor. See paragraph 3.04 of this chapter for more information.

3.104 In addition to the audited financial statements, broker-dealers are required to file a compliance report or an exemption report annually. An independent auditor will be required to examine the broker-dealer’s compliance report relating to specific financial responsibility rules or review the statements included in the broker-dealer’s exemption report, pursuant to PCAOB standards. However, if the broker-dealer is also registered with the CFTC as a futures commission merchant or introducing broker, an internal control report is required by CFTC Regulation 1.16(d).
